bibl.title: Letter from L. O. Howard to Jefferson Randolph Kean, February 24, 1925

div1.p: Having reviewed a manuscript copy sent to him by Kean, Howard congratulates Kean on the forceful and just article he has written.

div1.head: Letter from L. O. Howard to Jefferson Randolph Kean, February 24, 1925
div1.opener:
Y.F
UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE
BUREAU OF ENTOMOLOGY
WASHINGTON, D. C.
February 24, 1925.
General J. R. Kean, U.S.A. (Retired),
Army Medical Museum,
Washington, D. C.
file under Gorgas Review
My dear General Kean:
div1.p:
Your note of the 21st and the carbon of your review have just come.
I have read this with great interest, and congratulate you on the forceful
and beautifully expressed statement. It seems to be to me absolutely just.
I thank you for your mention of my name. It comes in very naturally, and
is needed, I think, to make the point concerning Reed's enthusiasm over
the conclusiveness of his demonstration. It is a pity that you cannot men-
tion your own name in connection with the important part you played in
Cuba, but I can readily understand that that must be left to some other
person.

I thank you for giving me the chance to read this manuscript. You
do not, in your note, tell me to return it, but, thinking that you may have
a use for it, I am enclosing it. I wish greatly to have a copy of the pub-
lished article. Can you have one sent to me?
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, L. O. Howard Chief of Bureau.
loh-wft
Enclosure.
